page.title: 05RELIGION IN THE LOCAL AREA
page.content: Religion plays a strong part in local life.There is a strong Roman Catholic in the area and a shrine was built in the 1920's by unemployed miners in Carfin. A grotto was built which is a miniature version of the Lourdes grotto in France.The grotto is visited by 10,000 people every year.Twice every month people come to worship. During the summer regular outdoor worship is held every Sunday.Some of the visitors come from as far away as England and the North of Scotland. There have been hardly any significant changes to the grotto,the mayor ones being the addition of a shrine,a small lake and a bridge commemmorating the visit of Pope John Paul II
